name: who

options.description: print ips instead of hostnames. with --lookup, canonicalizes based on stored IP, if available, rather than stored hostname
attempt to canonicalize hostnames via DNS
only hostname and user associated with stdin
print active processes spawned by init
all login names and number of users logged on
print only name, line, and time (default)
add user's message status as +, - or ?

tldr:
> Display who is logged in and related data (processes, boot time).
> More information: <https://www.gnu.org/software/coreutils/who>.

- Display the username, line, and time of all currently logged-in sessions:

`who`

- Display information only for the current terminal session:

`who am i`

- Display all available information:

`who -a`

- Display all available information with table headers:

`who -a -H`
